en: You know who you believe the target audience is for your product, but you haven't done any actual market research into this idea. With the pitch so close, you don't have time to get solid data yourself.
Hire a firm to do it for you for $1000 or go with your intial assumptions?
Though it hurts your wallet to do it, you hire out a firm.
They come back with not just a good understanding of who you're marketing to, but a bunch of suggestions that should help make your product better overall. How useful!
You save the money and keep to your initial instincts. After all, you wouldn't have started making this product without an intuitive understand of who it's for.
